Title: Surprise! Fortnite is getting a new map and mode on Saturday
Content:
Itâs time to return to Tilted Towers. Fortnite is getting a surprise update this weekend. Itâs called âReloadâ and itâll launch on Saturday, the official Fortnite account said on X. A teaser trailer revealed it this update will introduce a new map and mode to Fortnite. 
You can view the full teaser on the official Fortnite X account. Longer-time players might recognize the map has classic locations from previous versions of the game like Tilted Towers, Retail Row, and more. Other than that, we donât have a lot of details on the update. However, the map looks a bit smaller than your average Fortnite map, so players will have to see how that will impact this new way to play. 
Oh hiiiii, Tilted   pic.twitter.com/PCfIJN7VUC
Fortnite is currently in Chapter 5 Season 3. The current version of the game, called âWrecked,â has players duke it out in a desert wasteland inspired by Fallout and features the metal band Metallica. At the moment, the game is going full Mad Max and allows players to fight with a variety of tricked out war vehicles and more. Itâs a rather chaotic way to play and has inspired criticism from players. Now, itâs looking like fans will be able to try their hand at a new play mode.

Title: League of Legendsâ new summer event includes a survivor-style game mode
Content:
League of Legendsâ summer event is always a highlight for the year. In past years, weâve seen visual novels and deep dives into alternate universes like Soul Fighter, Spirit Blossom, or Star Guardian. This year, the Anima Squad skin line gets the spotlight, along with a new survivor-style bullet heaven game that can be played co-op or solo.
Anima Squad debuted in 2022, and depicts League champions as cybernetic, animal-themed warriors defending humanity. This year, weâre getting new crew members like Battle Bunny Aurora, the new championâs debut skin; Battle Bear Illaoi; and Cyber Cat Yuumi. 
In the lore of Anima Squad, humanity has been pushed back to a few bastions. Primordials, the white blood cells of Earth, have become hostile to humanity. These kaiju-like creatures are swarming out of the oceans, and only a few heroes wearing repurposed Primordial technology can protect what remains.
The new game mode is called Swarm, or Operation: Anima Squad. Players can queue up solo, or play with up to three friends. This game mode plays very differently than standard League of Legends; itâs much closer to Vampire Survivors with a WASD control scheme. The player must survive a showdown in Final City, mowing down waves of Primordials. Every match gives rewards that lead to greater power over time, so even a failed match can pay off down the road and eventually help you survive longer, kill more Primordials, and earn more rewards.
Weâre also getting a huge list of new skins: Seraphine, Yuumi, Leona, Xayah, Illaoi, Aurora, and Yasuo join Anima Squad while Briar, RekâSai, and BelâVeth play the antagonistic Primordials (although Briar defects to join the good guys, making her a bit of both). This year, the summer event runs from July 17 to Aug. 19. As with past game modes, itâs possible that Swarm could return to League of Legends in the future â weâll have to wait and see what Riot thinks of player reception to Operation: Anima Squad first.

Title: Dune: Awakeningâs alternate history setup sounds fascinating
Content:
Itâs not easy to adapt a fictional property â The Lord of the Rings, say, or the DC Universe âinto a massively multiplayer online game, or any kind of living game. Many have failed. The demands of a set canon are seldom compatible with an evolving online world, or a universe in which thousands of players are living their own heroâs journeys.
Funcom knows this: The Norwegian developer has been making MMOs since 2001âs Anarchy Online, including a licensed effort, Age of Conan. So, for survival MMO Dune: Awakening, Funcom, Frank Herbertâs estate, and Legendary (producers of the Dune movies) decided to do something very smart: change the Dune timeline and establish its own alternate history of Arrakis.
As teased in the gameâs Summer Game Fest trailer and detailed in a new half-hour deep dive video, in Dune: Awakeningâs setting, Paul Atreides was never born. His mother, Lady Jessica, chose to have a daughter instead of a son, tying her more closely to the Bene Gesserit; Jessica is trained as a truthsayer and foretells Doctor Yuehâs betrayal, so her husband, Duke Leto, survives and House Atreides isnât wiped out in the attack on Arrakeen.
With Paul out of the picture, thereâs a power vacuum, and more narrative room for players to feel like the heroes of their own stories. And House Atreides and House Harkonnen are evenly matched in a war for the future of Arrakis â a convenient setup for the factional gameplay that MMOs thrive on. But the essential political motivations of all the characters and players remain the same as in Frank Herbertâs original vision.
The Fremen are the final piece of this puzzle, and Funcom has chosen to put them at the center of a narrative mystery. The desert inhabitants of Arrakis have disappeared â supposedly wiped out, according to Imperium propaganda. What happened to them? Where did they go? Players are sent in search of the missing people, exploring their abandoned dwellings, rites, culture, and spirituality as they go. (Iâd say the chances of the Fremen being added as a playable faction later on, perhaps in an expansion, seem pretty high.)
In terms of gameplay, the video is a little lighter on detail, but there are some interesting tidbits. A look at the character creator reveals that a choice of mentor determines your characterâs starting ability: Choose a Mentat mentor and youâll be able to scan enemies and objects for information; a Bene Gesserit mentor will teach you to use the Voice to compel characters to approach you (effectively a taunt); a Swordmaster background grants you a defensive stance. But youâll be able to combine abilities from the different schools later in the game.
In a section of the video focused on the gameâs closed beta and its online structure, creative director Joel Bylos said that Dune: Awakeningâs endgame lies in an area called the Deep Desert. There, hundreds of concurrent players will engage in player-versus-player combat, harvest spice in big groups, and engage with an endgame political system.
Bylos also explained what makes the game an MMO. As opposed to a single-server, single-map game like Ark: Survival Evolved, Dune: Awakening will group multiple maps and servers together into âworldsâ of thousands of players who can organize themselves into guilds. The starting area, Hagga Basin, supports a minimum of 40 players per server, but beyond that there are social hubs and the Deep Desert, where Bylos promised âmany, many hundredsâ of players will be able to play together. The Overland map is its own live server that links these locations, with players using Ornithopters and other transportation to move around it in real time.
Dune: Awakening has no announced release date, but itâs coming to PlayStation 5, Windows PC, and Xbox Series X. Funcom says it will show live gameplay at Gamescom, which runs from Aug. 21-25.

Title: Every Blu-ray should come with Kingdom of the Planet of the Apesâ best special feature
Content:
Itâs no secret that Kingdom of the Planet of the Apes is a visual-effects-heavy movie. After all, there are only two human characters, and every other speaking part in the movie belongs to a CGI ape. But just because there are a lot of digital characters doesnât mean the actors portraying them werenât giving full performances. In fact, most of the characters were fully motion-captured, and the movieâs 4K Ultra HD Blu-ray is here to prove it. 
The Kingdom of the Planet of the Apes 4K set includes a special version of the movie, dubbed The Raw Cut, thatâs a split-screen version of the entire movie â one side is the finished film and the other is stripped of all the filmâs visual effects. In other words, itâs just the actors in their mocap suits acting out the scenes as their ape characters. (The Raw Cut is not included in the Blu-ray or DVD releases of the movie â just the 4K Blu-ray.) 
On the one hand, this is probably a very awkward way to watch the movie in which youâre constantly confronted with the fact that the whole thing is just a bunch of people pretending to be monkeys. On the other hand, The Raw Cut is an excellent way to show off just how much work the actors are doing and how incredible their full-body performances are. 
Showcasing the work of motion capture actors has never really been easy. First popularized with Andy Serkisâ performance as Gollum in The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers in 2002, unfinished footage of actors performing in mocap suits has provided insight into just how complicated the process is and how intricate the physical performance can be. But this Kingdom special feature shows one way filmmakers can show off just how incredible their filmsâ performers are, which is why it should become standard for every visual effects-heavy movie. 
The 4K UHD Blu-ray version of Kingdom of the Planet of the Apes is set to be released on Aug. 27. The Raw Cut will also include an optional commentary track featuring director Wes Ball, editor Dan Zimmerman, and VFX supervisor Erik Winquist.

Title: The highly anticipated Altered TCG introduces The Sandman, a tribute to Neil Gaiman
Content:
Altered is the new trading card game from startup Equinox Studio that earned nearly $7 million on Kickstarter earlier this year. With distribution being handled globally by board and card game giant Asmodee, the French-made TCG is ready to go head-to-head against Magic: The Gathering, Disney Lorcana, Flesh & Blood, and Star Wars: Unlimited with a bevy of unique features. Now, in advance of the United Statesâ retail release on Sept. 13, weâre getting our first look at the gameâs fantastical factions.
Today Polygon can exclusively reveal The Sandman, a powerful character from the gameâs Lyra faction.
In Altered, players explore a fanciful post-apocalyptic setting where the world outside the city of Asgartha has been completely transformed. Itâs up to players to conduct successful expeditions, becoming the first player at the table to reunite their deckâs main character and a lovable sidekick. 
âItâs a chaotic place with lots of volatile ideas,â said Altered narrative designer Yoshi Mimura. âThe [player character] is an Alterer, [and] the power of the Alterer is to shape the world around them so that they can stabilize the regions where they meet to help [make] the world a more sustainable and livable place.â
Itâs a game about creation, not destruction, and Mimura says that The Sandman has an important role to play.
âLyra tend to focus on imagination, and stories, and legends, and everything that is transmitted orally,â Mimura said. âThe Sandman is kind of a creator of worlds, and a person who can shape dreams. They can inspire people, and by doing so we can try to make the world a better place. Itâs also a character that is profoundly linked to a personal hero of mine, Neil Gaiman.â
When players pull cards from a blind pack in Altered, they have the chance to pull either the common of the more rare versions of The Sandman. The rare version above, which retains its Lyra faction allegiance, costs one less to play from a playerâs reserve and allows for a boost of two to be optionally placed on top of it. That makes it cheaper to play, and more powerful in the field. 
Both versions of the card also allow a player to apply a status, called Asleep, to another Character on the table. According to one of the gameâs designers, FranÃ§ois Jourdain, the Asleep status can be used either defensively or offensively. The easiest way to use it would be to put an opponentâs character to sleep, removing them from the ensuing conflict and allowing you to make progress against your opponent. But you can also use it on your own characters: Asleep can prevent them from participating in a combat they are sure to lose, or players can proactively place characters asleep in order to bring them forward in following rounds more cheaply or alongside more powerful allies. Itâs a debuff, a feint, and an attack strategy all in one.
A third, even more rare version of the card applies those same powers but to a different faction. This one, called Ordis, opens up even more and different strategic possibilities. Mimura was quick to add that other versions of The Sandman will likely surface in the future.
âWhen you materialize a character from imagination,â Mimura said, âyou can feed it with your own vision of what the character is. [...] So maybe in the future [...] he will have a completely different face, or maybe it will be women. We try to have all the options open to showcase a lot of diversity.â

Title: Beyond Good & Evil 4K remaster is finally official, out next week
Content:
The original Beyond Good & Evil is getting a 4K overhaul for its 20th anniversary, Ubisoft announced Thursday during a Limited Run Games showcase. Beyond Good & Evil - 20th Anniversary Edition will bring updated graphics, controls, and audio to the beloved original.
Beyond Good & Evil - 20th Anniversary Edition will feature improved performance â âup to 4K, 60 fps,â Ubisoft said â and quality-of-life improvements including auto saves, cutscene skipping, controller and keyboard-and-mouse support, and cross-save across all platforms. All-new features include a speedrun mode, 20-plus new achievements and trophies, and a gallery that delves into the original gameâs development with never-before-seen artwork and videos.
The Beyond Good & Evil re-release may not be much of a surprise to longtime fans; the gameâs existence (and even an unfinished version of the remaster itself) leaked last fall.
The original Beyond Good & Evil was released in 2003 on GameCube, PC, PlayStation 2, and Xbox. Set more than 400 years in the future, the story of Beyond Good & Evil follows photojournalist Jade in her attempt to expose an alien conspiracy. Despite being a commercial miss, the game became a cult classic over the years. In 2017, Ubisoft announced a prequel named Beyond Good & Evil 2, but the publisher hasnât said much about it lately. The last official word on BG&E 2 came in 2021, when Ubisoft said the sequel was still in development. But the stars of Beyond Good & Evil â Jade and Peyâj â recently appeared in Ubisoftâs animated series Captain Laserhawk: A Blood Dragon Remix.
Beyond Good & Evil - 20th Anniversary Edition will be released digitally on June 25, on Nintendo Switch, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Windows PC, Xbox One, and Xbox Series X. A physical version (and a collectorâs edition) will be released by Limited Run Games. Pre-orders for the physical versions of Beyond Good & Evil - 20th Anniversary Edition will go live on July 12.

Title: New Elden Ring patch makes the final boss fight suck a lot less
Content:
A new patch for Elden Ring was released Thursday, ostensibly to prepare the game for the arrival of the Shadow of the Erdtree DLC on June 21. But players of the base game are also getting a lovely treat, in the form of a major quality-of-life update to the base gameâs final boss battle.
According to Bandai Namcoâs patch notes for version 1.12 of Elden Ring, developer FromSoftware has added a ânew feature to summon spectral steed during the Elden Beast boss battle.â Elden Ring players who have faced the Elden Beast will know what a relief it is to have Torrent available in this situation, as the final boss battle involves a torturous amount of running from one side of the battle arena to the other, back and forth, and back and forth again, while chasing the always-moving monster.
While the Elden Beast battle was a majestic and challenging final confrontation, the incessant running around players had to do to get in a few swipes of a sword or get within spellcasting range was something of a nightmare. Especially since the Elden Beast is a two-parter; one needs to defeat another boss, Radagon, before facing the beast, and failure in the second part meant repeating the first.
But the ability to summon Torrent in the Elden Beast boss fight isnât the only major quality-of-life update for Elden Ring in patch 1.12. FromSoft has added a new âRecent Itemsâ tab to playersâ inventory screen, letting them easily find the latest thing (weapon, cookbook, talisman, etc.) theyâve picked up. Newly obtained items are marked with a â!â symbol, which will be hugely important for players acquiring a ton of new stuff with Shadow of the Erdtree. (Note that the Recent Items tab is an opt-in feature in the gameâs settings menu, and having used it for the past week, I highly recommend turning it on!)
Elden Ring patch 1.12 does a whole lot more. There are new hairstyles, new PvP-exclusive balance adjustments, and a long list of weapon and skill tweaks, all of which are worth reviewing before diving into Shadow of the Erdtree for the first time.

Title: The Penguin looks like a heaping helping of Gotham City mob drama
Content:
September is not too far away, and The Penguin, Maxâs The Batman spinoff TV series, seems to know it. A new trailer for the show gets right down to it in a way that previous teases avoided: This is a cutthroat mafia succession story set in the dark and oily Gotham City showcased in Matt Reevesâ Robert Pattinson-led 2022 film. 
The Batman star Colin Farrell now has a whole cast to strive against in his quest to fill the power vacuum following the death of boss Carmine âThe Romanâ Falcone â and itâs a whoâs who of Gotham City mafia figures from the most influential mafia-focused Batman books. Clancy Brown plays Salvatore Maroni, the guy who threw acid in Harvey Dentâs face; Michael Kelly plays Johnny Viti, Falconeâs nephew and enforcer introduced in Batman: Year One; and Michael Zegen plays Alberto Falcone, a major player in Batman: The Long Halloween. Finally, Cristin Milioti plays a woman who appears to be Oswald âOzâ Cobbâs biggest rival for power, Sofia âGiganteâ Falcone, the daughter of The Roman. 
Weâll see who comes out on top â and whether Batman has anything to say about it â when The Penguin premieres on the Max streaming service in September.

Title: League of Legendsâ next champion is Aurora, a spirit walking bunny girl
Content:
The League of Legends roster is a huge and diverse, containing everything from a friendly boy scout badger to apocalyptic, world-ending threats. The newest champion looks friendly and approachable â but she also hangs out with primal spirits and ancient demigods. Meet Aurora, the Witch Between Worlds. Aurora is a mage that can play either in the mid or solo lane, and her abilities are defined by her vision of both the material realm and the spirit world.
Aurora is a vastayan, a vast culture of animal-like people spread across Runeterra. Sheâs a bunny-girl, complete with a big fluffy tail and long legs. She hails from the Freljord, and has connections with Ornn, Anivia, Volibear, and Udyr. Despite this, Aurora isnât invested in the big three-way war that takes place in most of the Freljord between the Avarosans, the Winterâs Claw, and the Frostguard. Sheâs much more focused on her own spiritual journey. 
Interestingly, Aurora is also on the autism spectrum; her unique way at looking at the world goes beyond just spiritual power. This is part of a larger attempt by Riot to increase representation on the champion roster and allow for a wider variety of characters, along with the addition of champions like Nilah, Renata Glasc, and KâSante.
Youâre in her realm now Get ready for Aurora, the Witch Between Worlds pic.twitter.com/ksWwNz4Wd7
Riot has released information on Auroraâs kit, which focuses on mobility, trickery, and ranged damage.
Passive â Spirit Abjuration 
If Aurora damages an enemy 3 times with her spells and attacks, she will deal magic damage and exorcise a spirit to her, entering Spirit Mode and gaining movement speed and empowering her healing for 3 seconds. For every additional spirit following Aurora, the bonuses from Spirit Mode are increased by 5%. 
Q â Twofold Hex 
Fire a blast of cursed energy in a direction, dealing magic damage to enemies hit and marking them with spirit energy. 
Recast: End the curse, drawing back the spirit energy to herself, dealing magic dealing to enemies passed through. 
W â Across the Veil 
Hop in a direction. Upon landing, enter the spirit realm, becoming Invisible and entering Spirit Mode for several seconds. 
Takedowns on enemy champions reset the cooldown of this ability. 
E â The Weirding 
Send out a blast of spirit magic dealing magic damage in an area and slowing them. Aurora will hop backwards slightly on cast. 
R â Between Worlds 
Send out a pulse of spirit energy that deals magic damage and slows enemies. The area merges with the spirit realm, granting Aurora an empowered spirit mode, and allowing her to travel from one end of the area to the other. Enemies who try to cross the threshold will take magic damage, be slowed, and be pushed back toward the center of the area.
Aurora will release in Patch 14.14, which is scheduled for July 17. The champion was originally teased in the League of Legends client, with a story that allowed the player to see Aurora meeting with the demigod Ornn.

Title: Smile 2 is making good on the originalâs viral marketing gimmick
Content:
The first Smile was a pretty good horror movie and a pretty massive hit. While those two facts are closely related, at least part of the movieâs cultural impact was thanks to its incredible marketing campaign where people showed up to high-profile events like sports games sporting the seriesâ trademark unnatural grin. It didnât have much to do with the movie, but it was undeniably effective. Thankfully, the first trailer for Smile 2, the seriesâ big-budget sequel, is here to make good on the originalâs marketing stunt.
Smile relied mostly on intimate, small-scale scares and the creepy idea that the person youâre talking to could be infected by the Smile curse without you even knowing it. The main character, Rose (Sosie Bacon), watched the curse spread through the various members of her life until she finally understood what was causing it. 
But the marketing campaign got at something much big and more sinister. Having normal(ish) people sitting at baseball games and grinning for the camera, implied something massive, an unknowable infection of sporadic unexplainable violence accompanied with an ear to ear smile and wide vacant eyes. Thankfully, this is the deep well that the new movie seems to be tapping into. 
Hereâs some fun, clever movie promo - Paramount seemingly placed #Smile actors in the crowd at both the Yankees and Mets games last night, both in view of cameras. The results were indeed creepy. Going to a game this weekend? Watch out for the smiles!   pic.twitter.com/aC3sqZjWvI
The trailer for the new movie primarily follows pop star Skye Riley (Naomi Scott), who seems to be in the middle of a massive nation-wide stadium tour â a popular venue for horror movies this year. Of course, smiles start to creep through the crowd and her fans without any explanation, and violence follows. 
It all looks far bigger and more expensive, but with the same methodical slow-paced scares that made the first movie so effective. And, even more importantly, adding in throngs of people makes the seriesâ signature grins even more terrifying, making the cursed victims stand out in the crowd, exactly like they did at the baseball games from the original promotions. 
Smile 2 is written and directed by Parker Finn, just like the original movie, and is set for release in theaters on Oct. 18.

Title: Valheim: The Board Game boils your server down to a 2-hour play session
Content:
Valheim: The Board Game was built off the success of Deep Rock Galactic: The Board Game, another tabletop adaptation of a popular video game that aims to keep the same vibe as the original. With Deep Rock Galactic, itâs easier to create a one-to-one experience â a match in the video game is a round of the board game. But Valheim is a sprawling experience thatâs harder to encapsulate. Valheim: The Board Game is coming to crowdfunding on Gamefound later this year.
Playing on a Valheim server with a cohort of pals is a big experience, made up of weeks and months of farming, building, adventure, boss fighting, and general Viking antics. So how does the board game adaptation boil all of that down into a two-hour session? Itâs no easy feat, but the designers looked to Valheimâs biomes and the altars that summon bosses like Bonemass or The Elder.
âThe video game is expansive. Not only is it a typical adventure, but you start with nothing. You have to create a home as well. I think of it as an adult version of Minecraft,â says Ole Steiness, lead designer of Valheim: The Board Game. âWhat weâve done is taken the same core concept and then divided it into scenarios of a larger campaign.â
Each session of the board game represents a scenario of a larger Valheim life in the 10th realm. âYou have to develop yourself and your home to be able to take on this challenge,â says Steiness. âYouâre going to explore the map, which is going to be tiles on the board, and youâll have events going on and creatures showing up to challenge you. As you fight your way through it, you gather resources so you and your friends can build up, make a cool character, a cool home, until you take on the big boss fight at the end of the game.â
Different sessions of Valheim: The Board Game will have different layouts and scenarios that play out over a two-hour game session. Not all of the scenarios will be tests of martial prowess. âIt was important to both us and Iron Gate [the developer of Valheim] that itâs not only about killing stuff â itâs about developing other traits and making sure that other parts work. Some people find it fun to build a house, or some people want to go explore. We have a 3D model of your home in the game, and itâs an empty house you have to fill out.â
In Valheim, new furniture and workbenches at the homestead raise your comfort level and allow you to craft new gear. Thatâs true in Valheim: The Board Game as well, which allows players to linger at home to enhance their equipment and build armor while others venture out into the Black Forest to kill monsters. In order to refine these roles, there are character archetypes: The Ranger is probably out scouting and fighting trolls, while the Sailor is focusing on securing naval routes, and the Gatherer gathers up everything needed for a nutritious stew. Everyone can do everything, but these roles allow players to specialize in a way similar to the original game.
The board will also change depending on the boss youâre fighting. Bonemass, for instance, will cause the board to be populated with more swamp biomes and poison tiles. When the endgame begins, the players flip the board, revealing a boss arena for the final showdown. 
Valheim: The Board Game will be available to back on Gamefound later in 2024. More details will be released on Valheimâs X feed and community Discord as they become available.

Title: Original Dragon Quest trilogy getting the âHD-2Dâ remake treatment
Content:
The long-awaited âHD-2Dâ remake of classic Enix role-playing game Dragon Quest 3 is coming to Nintendo Switch this November, publisher Square Enix announced Tuesday during a Nintendo Direct showcase. But Dragon Quest 3 HD-2D isnât the only classic Erdrick adventure coming from Square Enix â the collection Dragon Quest 1 & 2 HD-2D was also announced Tuesday, giving fans of Akira Toriyama and Yuji Horiiâs RPG series a lavishly remade trilogy to enjoy over the next year.
Dragon Quest 3 HD-2D will send players on a remade fantasy adventure as The Hero to take down the archfiend Baramos, traveling to towns, dungeons, and underground caves, and battling slimes and other Toriyama-designed monsters in turn-based battles. The original Dragon Quest 3 is set before the events of the first two games in the series, so, chronologically, playing Dragon Quest 3 HD-2D first will prep you for the next two games.
Square Enix didnât say much about whatâs changing for Dragon Quest 1 & 2 HD-2D, or whether they will feature expanded narratives as Dragon Quest 3 HD-2D will, but that seems quite likely.
Dragon Quest 3 HD-2D will be released on Nov. 14 on Nintendo Switch. Dragon Quest 1 & 2 HD-2D are due sometime in 2025.
Square Enixâs brand of HD-2D games started with developer Acquireâs retro RPG Octopath Traveler in 2018. The RPG publisher saw the potential in HD-2D for both new releases and remakes; the style has since been employed for Octopath Traveler 2 and tactics RPG Triangle Strategy, with plans for more remakes beyond the early Dragon Quest games.

Title: Perfect Dark, Metroid, and multiplayer Legend of Zelda are all coming to Nintendoâs subscription service
Content:
Nintendo announced a small, but mighty list of additions heading to its premium subscription service as part of the Nintendo Direct on Tuesday. The Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past Four Swords; Metroid: Zero Mission; Turok: Dinosaur Hunter; and Perfect Dark are all being released to Nintendo Switch Online + Expansion Pack on Tuesday.
Any title on its own would be a formidable addition to the catalog of games offered on the subscription service, but now we get all four. Metroid: Zero Mission is a classic Metroid game and highly regarded as one of the best entries in the series. Turok: Dinosaur Hunter takes players back to some good prehistoric hunting and exploring on the Nintendo 64. As for Perfect Dark, there couldnât be a better time to revisit the original given that the reboot just got a big gameplay trailer at the recent Xbox Games Showcase â and the game will have online multiplayer. 
Then, of course, thereâs another Zelda game. The standard Nintendo Switch Online already contains the NES version of The Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past, but now people will be able to play the quirkier Four Swords addition to the game that came out to the GameBoy Advance in 2002. The best part? This game will also have online multiplayer so now those who didnât have enough copies of the game (or enough handhelds) as kids might finally be able to revisit and play the classic with friends. 
An individual subscription to Nintendo Switch Online + Expansion Pack costs $49.99 per year or you can also buy a family membership that costs $79.99 per year and can include up to eight users.

Title: Everything announced at Nintendo Direct June 2024
Content:
Though Nintendo didnât show its upcoming Switch successor during its Nintendo Direct broadcast Tuesday, the company outlined its release schedule for the second half of 2024. The June Nintendo Direct ran for 40 minutes and showcased everything expected in the coming months, including a brand new Zelda game. There were even a few teases for 2025, including the long-awaited Metroid Prime 4.
Thereâs plenty left on the Nintendo schedule to hold eager fans over until Nintendoâs next console is revealed. Hereâs all the news and game announcements shown during Tuesdayâs event, which could be considered an extension of last weekâs Summer Game Fest, where other major publishers showed off their works-in-progress.
Mario and Luigi are bouncing around in Nintendoâs latest game in the Mario and Luigi franchise â the first in almost 10 years. Mario & Luigi: Brothership will be released on Nintendo Switch on Nov. 7.
Nintendo World Championships: NES Edition is all about speedrunning and challenges. There are also modes that put you head-to-head with other players in an attempt to be the last one standing as you make your way through the challenges. Itâs here on July 18.
Koei Tecmo Americaâs Fairy Tail 2 is a take on the anime Fairy Tail. In this real-time strategy game, youâll take on enemies in collaborative battles. Itâs coming this winter, Nintendo said.
From Final Fantasy creator Hironobu Sakaguchi, Fantasian Neo Dimension is a turn-based role-playing game where youâre taking on an evil guy that wants to destroy âall mankind,â according to Nintendo. The interdimensional game launches on Nintendo Switch this holiday.
Basketball is coming to Spocco Square, where up to four players can team up locally and online to shoot some hoops. Itâll come to Nintendo Switch this summer.
Mio: Memories in Orbit is all about its pretty, watercolor world. Not much information was shared outside of the trailer, except that itâs coming in 2025.
A new mystery update is coming to Disney Illusion Island â and itâs launching on Nintendo Switch Tuesday, the same day as the Direct.
Hello Kitty Island Adventure, originally available only on mobile, is coming to the Nintendo Switch (and PlayStation and Xbox consoles). Itâs a timed exclusive, though, meaning Nintendo players will get the super cute Animal Crossing: New Horizons-like game first.
Looney Tunes: Wacky World of Sports has four arcade-style sports minigames, including soccer and basketball â all with a Looney Tunes spin, like falling anvils. Itâll launch on Nintendo Switch this fall.
Among Us is getting a free update Tuesday with new crewmate and imposter roles, like the tracker, which plants trackers, or an imposter who can turn invisible.
Felicidad is a realm of monsters where a guy named Ten needs to take on a big army. The game is a farming simulator where you raise monsters to help you battle. Farmagia is coming to Nintendo Switch on Nov. 1.
Originally released on the Wii, Donkey Kong Country Returns will be released on Nintendo Switch on Jan. 16.
Dragon Quest 3 HD-2D Remake will be coming to Nintendo Switch on Nov. 14, bringing the classic game to modern consoles. Remakes of Dragon Quest 1 and Dragon Quest 2, in HD-2D form, will come in 2025.
10:10 Games showed off Funko Fusion, an action adventure game where you play as Funko characters â all set in different shows and movies, like Jurassic Park. Itâll come to Nintendo Switch on Sept. 13.
Luigiâs Mansion 2 is getting an HD upgrade when it launches on Nintendo Switch on June 27.
The New Denpa Men looks like a weird version of Animal Crossing, with minigames. Itâs coming July 27 on Nintendo Switch.
Metal Slug Attack Reloaded is coming to Nintendo Switch on Tuesday! Surprise!
Gothic roguelike role-playing game Darkest Dungeon is getting a sequel, Darkest Dungeon 2. Itâs coming to Nintendo Switch on July 15.
The Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past Four Swords, Metroid: Zero Mission, Turok: Dinosaur Hunter, and Perfect Dark are coming to Nintendo Switch Online + Expansion today. Youâll be able to play Four Swords online with friends for the first time, too.
Marona is on a journey to save her friend Ash in Phantom Brave: The Lost Hero, which looks super cute and is coming to Nintendo Switch in 2025.
Marvel vs. Capcom Fighting Collection: Arcade Classics is seven whole games coming as one collection.
Super Mario Party Jamboree has a whole bunch of new boards and tons of minigames, including a board set in a mall and another on a race course. Five new board games and two from previous games are available in total. Up to 20 players can compete online, too, in new modes. Itâs the biggest Mario Party yet, Nintendo said. Itâs coming Oct. 17 to Nintendo Switch.
Finally, a game starring Zelda! In The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom, a stylized, Linkâs Awakening-like version of the franchise, Zelda takes on her own adventure. When Link vanishes, Zelda needs to step in to save the day. Itâs coming Sept. 26.
A new Nintendo Switch, all gold with the Hyrule crest, is coming on Sept. 26 alongside the new Zelda game.
Ariana Grande, Enur, Sia, and more artists will come to Just Dance 2025 with lots of new dances and challenges to take on. Hundreds of songs in total, coming in October.
Nintendo had another little peek at Lego Horizon Adventures, which was first announced during Summer Game Fest. Itâs coming this holiday season, Nintendo said.
Stray, the kitty cat adventure game, is coming to Nintendo Switch during the holiday season.
Live as a hobbit in Tales of the Shire: A Lord of the Rings Game. Itâs basically a life sim set in the Lord of the Rings world, and it looks lovely. Itâs coming to Nintendo Switch this holiday season.
Two Ace Attorney games are coming to Nintendo Switch as a single collection: Ace Attorney Investigations Collection. Itâll be released on Nintendo Switch on Sept. 6.
The Hundred Line: Last Defense Academy is coming in early 2025, Nintendo said. The enemies may look cute â but theyâre also deadly!
âRule and expandâ is the name of the game in Romancing SaGa 2: Revenge of the Seven. The turn-based battles are flashy and strategic â and the game is coming Oct. 24.
Metroid Prime 4 was first announced in 2017, but itâs been a long time since weâve heard anything else. This is the first look, and Nintendo is not expecting its release until 2025; development had to be restarted in 2019 under Retro Studios.

Title: Metroid Prime 4 trailer shows first gameplay, 2025 release date
Content:
After years of anticipation (and a major development shakeup), Nintendo gave fans a first look at Metroid Prime 4 during Tuesdayâs Nintendo Direct. The game is now known as Metroid Prime 4: Beyond, and it will come to Switch in 2025, Nintendo said.
The first trailer for Metroid Prime 4: Beyond features some actual gameplay, with galactic bounty hunter Samus Aran battling hordes of space pirates, scanning alien environments for clues, and going into ball mode to traverse the environment. It was all classic Metroid stuff, and a tease of a very exciting adventure to come.
Metroid fans also got a peek at what appears to be Metroid Prime 4: Beyondâs villain, a space pirate commander who commands two Metroids as pets. 
Nintendo first announced that a new entry in the Metroid Prime series was in the works at E3 2017. At that time, the company only showed a logo for the game, and since then has not provided game details or shown gameplay. At E3 2018, Nintendo did not showcase the game, saying it did not want to repeatedly tease fans until the game was closer to completion. Then, in 2019, Nintendo said it was rebooting development of Metroid Prime 4 and shifting the project to Retro Studios, the Metroid Prime seriesâ original developer.
Metroid Prime 4 marks the return of the popular take on the classic adventure series, which debuted on Nintendo GameCube and was last seen on Wii with 2007âs Metroid Prime 3: Corruption.
Metroid Prime 3âs follow-up was Metroid: Other M, a Wii game that failed to win over fans of Samus Aranâs intergalactic adventures. Nintendo never made a Metroid game for Wii U, although it released a reimagining of Metroid 2: Samus Returns for Nintendo 3DS in 2017. Samusâ most recent adventure, Metroid Dread, was released on Nintendo Switch in October 2021. That was followed by Metroid Prime Remastered for Switch in early 2023.

Title: New Legend of Zelda game finally makes Zelda the playable hero of Hyrule
Content:
The next Legend of Zelda game will give Princess Zelda herself the starring role. Nintendo announced The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom during its latest Nintendo Direct showcase, confirming that the Zelda-led adventure will come to Switch later this year.
The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom looks a lot like 2019âs remake of The Legend of Zelda: Linkâs Awakening from a graphical perspective, but it will play very differently. Zelda series producer Eiji Aonuma said that Echoes of Wisdom will feature âa new gameplay style that breaks conventions;â in other words, Zelda wonât just fight like Link. Instead, sheâll use a new magical rod, the Tri Rod, and the power of wisdom to create and duplicate objects to help her overcome obstacles and enemies.

    Related
  
Those duplicated objects are known as echoes, Nintendo says, and include things like water blocks that can be used as platforms, beds that can be repurposed into bridges, and even enemies that will fight alongside Zelda and her fairy friend Tri.
Out on Switch Sept. 26, The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom is the first Nintendo-developed game to explicitly star Zelda as the main protagonist. Typically, hero duties are reserved for Link, and longtime Nintendo fans have hoped for decades that Zelda would get a heroic turn in the series that bears her name.
Princess Zelda has been playable in a handful of games from Nintendo and other developers over the past four decades. Sheâs a playable character in spinoffs like the Hyrule Warriors action games, the Super Smash Bros. series, and in rhythm game Cadence of Hyrule. In 2009âs The Legend of Zelda: Spirit Tracks, players take control of a version of Zelda, in spirit form, during segments of the game.
Two Zelda-starring games that Nintendo would likely prefer to forget are 1993âs Zelda: The Wand of Gamelon and 1996âs Zeldaâs Adventure, a pair of interactive adventures developed for the Philips CD-i multimedia player.

Title: A brand-new Mario & Luigi adventure is coming to Switch
Content:
A new Mario & Luigi adventure â Mario & Luigi: Brothership â is coming to Switch this November, Nintendo announced Tuesday at its latest Nintendo Direct. Itâs the first new Mario & Luigi game in nine years; the last was 2015âs Mario & Luigi: Paper Jam for Nintendo 3DS. 
In the first trailer for Mario & Luigi: Brothership, we see Mario and Luigi facing an all-new electrical threat, and joined by electric plug-inspired allies Connie and Snoutlet, on their seafaring adventure. More familiar friends and foes â Princess Peach and Bowser and his minions â are also here. In Mario & Luigi tradition, the plumber-adventurer duo team up to use evolved Bros. moves in combat and for platforming as they adventure through the world of Concordia. 
Helping the bros get around is a part-ship, part-island method of transport known as Shipshape Island. The ship-island will take them to a variety of environments, ranging from tropical rainforests to bustling cities, Nintendo said in an announcement.
Mario & Luigi: Brothership sets sail for Nintendo Switch on Nov. 7. It will be the sixth entry in the Mario & Luigi series of action-role-playing games, which started with 2003âs Mario & Luigi: Superstar Saga for Game Boy Advance. Itâs unclear who is developing Brothership, as former Mario & Luigi developer AlphaDream shuttered in 2019.

Title: Hello Kitty Island Adventure is coming to Nintendo Switch and other consoles
Content:
Hello Kitty Island Adventure, an adorable life-sim featuring a cast of Sanrio characters, has been freed from Apple Arcade jail. Developer Sunblink and Sanrio announced the game will be released on the Nintendo Switch and Windows PC in 2025. After that, it will also come to PlayStation 5 and PlayStation 4, a release said. The developer shared the news via a trailer as part of the Nintendo Direct on Tuesday. 
Hello Kitty Island Adventure has all the fixings of an adorable life-sim and then some. You can design an adorable character, collect materials, craft, fish, and explore alongside a rather large cast of Sanrio characters. The game, which was originally released on iOS via Apple Arcade in summer 2023, continues to be updated by the development team. The developers released a mermaid-inspired update as recently as May and the flowery Merry Meadow to celebrate spring.
Fans of Animal Crossing: New Horizons might immediately notice parallels between the two games both in terms of the cutesy art style and gameplay. Hello Kitty Island Adventure definitely goes a lot harder on the âadventureâ part of it all â you spend a lot of time climbing and exploring in Island Adventure â but it could be a great option for Animal Crossing fans looking for a game to hold them over until the release of the Nintendo Switch successor.

Title: Octopath Traveler 2, Callisto Protocol lead a June 2024 Game Pass update
Content:
Xboxâs bow at Summer Game Fest solidified major plans for the Game Pass service in 2025. But thatâs the future. The Game Pass of June 2024 is... a bit lighter. 
Following a similarly short May lineup, June offers lauded RPG Octopath Traveler has returned to the platform along with its slightly less lauded but equally gorgeous-looking sequel Octopath Traveler 2. Dead Space fans should be keen to try The Callisto Protocol, a 2022 sci-fi survival horror game that wasnât a total knockout but had plenty of the DNA that made Dead Space games great â basically the ideal Game Pass game? Those looking for something new should keep eyes peeled on Still Wakes the Deep, horror game set on an oil rig thatâs going day 1 on the service. 
From 3D farm sims like My Time at Sandrock to 2D RPGs like Keplerth, a more minor June still has a little something for everyone. Hereâs the lineup.
The end of June and start of July will also see a number of other titles leaving Game Pass â nothing too notable, though.

Title: Watch the new Nintendo Direct for a look at the Switch 2024 lineup
Content:
Nintendo will broadcast a new Nintendo Direct presentation on Tuesday, June 18, a showcase focused on Switch titles coming in 2024.
Juneâs Nintendo Direct will run for about 40 minutes and will start at 10 a.m. EDT/7 a.m. PDT. The showcase will stream on Nintendoâs YouTube and Twitch channels. Nintendo tempered expectations for the showcase in a news release on Monday: âThere will be no mention of the Nintendo Switch successor during this presentation,â the company said.
Nintendo only has a couple of Switch games with confirmed release dates at the moment: Luigiâs Mansion 2 HD and Nintendo World Championships: NES Edition. Of course, the company may have a few surprises in store. Nintendo still has Metroid Prime 4 on its schedule, and itâs rumored to be sitting on a handful of remakes and remasters of its past games.
Confirmed not to appear during Juneâs Nintendo Direct is the companyâs next console. In May, Nintendo president Shuntaro Furukawa said in a public announcement, âWe will be holding a Nintendo Direct this June regarding the Nintendo Switch software lineup for the latter half of 2024, but please be aware that there will be no mention of the Nintendo Switch successor during that presentation.â The company reiterated that message in Mondayâs news release â no console news.
The âSwitch 2â is reportedly coming sometime in early 2025, and we may not hear official details from Nintendo on that next-gen console until this fall or winter.

Title: Sim game Life By You canceled after 3 early access delays
Content:
Life By You, Paradox Interactiveâs potential The Sims 4 competitor, has been canceled. Paradox Interactive deputy CEO Mattias Lilja announced the gameâs cancellation in a post on the publisherâs forum. âSadly, weâve decided to cancel the release of our long-awaited life sim Life by You,â Lilja wrote. âThis was an incredibly difficult call to make and is a clear failure on Paradoxâs part to meet both our own and the communityâs expectations.â
Life By You was last scheduled for its early access release on June 4, but Paradox delayed the game indefinitely on May 20. The May delay was the third time the early access release was pushed back â it was first intended for September 2023, March 5, then June 4. Lilja said the game had âincremental improvementsâ with each delay, but that the road to release was âfar too long and uncertain.â Hereâs Lilja on the delay:
A few weeks back, we decided to hold off on an Early Access release in order to re-evaluate Life by You, as we still felt that the game was lacking in some key areas. Though a time extension was an option, once we took that pause to get a wider view of the game, it became clear to us that the road leading to a release that we felt confident about was far too long and uncertain. This is not to say the game has not shown any promising qualities; Life by You had a number of strengths and the hard work of a dedicated team that went into realizing them. However, when we come to a point where we believe that more time will not get us close enough to a version we would be satisfied with, then we believe it is better to stop. This is obviously tough and disappointing for everyone who poured their time and enthusiasm into this project, especially when our decision comes so late in the process.
At the end of the day, our job is to release games that are fun, interesting, and challenging for our players, and our every decision should be taken with that purpose in mind. When we get that right, we earn our pay. So, how do we ensure we donât find ourselves here again? Honestly, there are no real guarantees. Games are difficult to get right, and weâll definitely make mistakes, which, as these things go, always become painfully apparent in hindsight, but still shouldnât reach this kind of magnitude regardless. We have to take a long and hard look at what led us here and see what changes we have to make to become better. In the end, our mission remains the same, and weâll continue to take whatever steps we need to do just that.
In a news release published on the Paradox Interactive website, CEO Fredik Wester said a version of Life By You that met the publisherâs expectations was âtoo far away.â Paradox Interactive is expecting its second quarter financial results to be ânegatively impactedâ by the gameâs write-down of development costs â adding to a poor performance with recent releases, according to Wester.
âWeâve performed poorly in recent releases,â Wester said. âEven though we now start new projects in a different manner, it is clear that we must make further changes so that quality is more consistent and the promises we make to our players are met. We have to evaluate how we manage projects and how we organize, for we will and must get better. We have a very solid financial position and a strong core game portfolio, which keeps us confident about our future.â
Paradox announced Paradox Tectonic, the studio tasked with developing Life By You, in 2019. Led by former Sims lead and Second Life creator Linden Labs CEO Rod Humble, Paradox Tectonic officially announced Life By You in 2023. Life By You was expected to stand out from the crowded life sim genre with deeper roleplaying elements. With the cancellation of Life By You, that genre just got a little less crowded â but thereâs still Paralives, inZOI, Project Rene (aka The Sims 5) and an unnamed life simulator from Midsummer Studios.

Title: Habbo Hotel going vintage with original game rerelease
Content:
The Habbo Hotel community â yes, thereâs still a community â is celebrating the announcement of Habbo Hotel Origins, a rerelease of the original game as it was in 2005. Habbo Hotel Origins goes live Tuesday; developer Sulake has been restoring the game for six months after it found âan old decrepit server with some long-lost files.â
Habbo Hotel has remained in existence (with plenty of ups and downs) since 2000, and people have been playing it since. It had a particularly large resurgence in 2020 during the pandemic. With all the tweaks and adjustments over the past 20 years, the modern version of Habbo Hotel looks a lot different than your childhood nostalgia. Habbo Hotel Origins is intended to fix that. âThe simplicity, charm and magic of that early version of Habbo are things we want to retain and protect, so we intend to be careful about what we add, and when,â Sulake wrote on the Habbo Hotel Origins website.
we're bringing back habbo hotel as it existed in 2005                                   !#HabboHotelOrigins pic.twitter.com/kcuM9OHuWQ
Sulake wrote that Habbo Hotel Origins will be âcommunity-led;â the InfoBus Park is now a âdemocratic forumâ where players can vote on changes to the game.
The Habbo Hotel Origins Reddit page is awash with celebration: The old times are back! There are some caveats to that, though: Habbo Hotel Origins wonât support casinos or any type of gambling, despite the game being for people 18 years or older. Habbo Hotel Origins wonât have any NFTs, either, unlike Habbo Hotel.
Sulake intends to keep Habbo Hotel Origins alive as long as the game sustains itself.

Title: Helldivers 2 dev made a donation to Save the Children because players chose to save the children
Content:
It turns out even slightly mean philosophical pranks by the developers of satirical wargames can have a heartwarming ending. Last week, Helldivers 2 developer Arrowhead Game Studios issued players with a new Major Order, and a stark moral choice: save a hospital of sick kids from an army of killer robots, or earn the cool anti-tank mines theyâve always wanted (at the third time of asking).
En masse, players selflessly chose the sick kids, and now they get their just reward: feeling good about themselves. Arrowheadâs chief creative officer Johan Pilestedt revealed on X that the studio had made a $4,311 donation to Save the Children to commemorate the communityâs in-game generosity.
Since the @helldivers2 community chose to save the children, @arrowheadgs does the same. We have made a donation to, well, Save the Children.Great job Divers!https://t.co/080PL27Y1u pic.twitter.com/yNhpiFWMlz
The good vibes continued within the game lore, too. The studioâs official Helldivers 2 account shared an adorable sketch of a smiling child holding hands with a Helldiver (next to a burning alien skull) and the following in-fiction message:
Dear Helldivers,
Thank you so much for saving us. They told us you made a lot of sacrifices (mines/lives) to help us. Weâll always be grateful. Now, we can grow up to become Helldivers too.
With Liberty,The Very Sick Children of Super Citizen Anneâs
We also have a special message to share with you:"Dear Helldivers,Thank you so much for saving us. They told us you made a lot of sacrifices (mines/lives) to help us. We'll always be grateful. Now, we can grow up to become Helldivers too.With Liberty,The Very Sick Childrenâ¦ pic.twitter.com/ZuiI4OQUaP
Aww. That warm fuzzy feeling youâre getting is worth more than a fake video game anti-tank mine, right?
Right?

Title: Fallout 76 finally stands triumphant â and thereâs more to come
Content:
Itâs been a long, hard road for Fallout 76 â but one that has finally led to a triumphant peak. The gameâs disastrous launch has been covered a thousand times from every angle; it was an intricate mess of overlapping problems that made the game difficult to play and extremely clippable for memes. But in 2024, the beleaguered game is stepping into the spotlight and enjoying a wave of positive attention. Bethesda has spent years patching up the ship, adding NPCs, companions, quests, Expeditions, factions, a battle royale mode, and more cryptids than you can shake a stick at.
The Fallout show on Amazon Prime kickstarted a wave of interest in everything Fallout; Steam charts have shown that every game in the franchise has found a new player base. The games published under Bethesdaâs umbrella are Fallout 3, Fallout: New Vegas, and Fallout 4. Each of these RPGs is a meaty campaign with enough content â and player-made mods â to sustain its own fandom of players. But Fallout 5 is a ways out, and Fallout 4 is nearly a decade old. The game best suited to draw in new fans who were hoping for just general Fallout vibes is Fallout 76.
âItâs no secret that Fallout 76 had some bumps at release,â said creative director Jonathan Rush in an email interview with Polygon. But even in its earliest days, Fallout 76 was defined by its enthusiastic community. These were players who loved the game, warts and all, and stuck around. It was largely because of these fans that I was able to eke out enjoyment of Fallout 76, and Iâve returned to the game on and off over the years, sampling from these delights. Early on, the high points came from other players, and uncovering the stories of the dead who came before.
âThe characters that initially launched with 76 were nuclear shadows, whose purpose was to tell the story of what all had happened between [when] the bombs drop and the point where you emerge from Vault 76,â said Rush. âSince Appalachia was initially devoid of human life, we relied on these characters as tools to give our players an understanding of the new world they had emerged into.â
But without characters in the world, and dialogue trees, Fallout 76 was missing much of the je ne sais quoi that makes a Fallout game. While the community team gathered feedback and part of the team provided smaller-scale updates and bug fixes, a larger group got to work on Wastelanders, the first expansion that added NPCs and a main quest to the game. âThe development for Wastelanders started very soon after launch and was a huge effort which involved all Bethesda Game Studios locations,â said Rush. âOn these types of games, itâs difficult to only support one of those â a dedicated group to maintain the integrity of the live service is crucial.â
Some of these updates have been much more experimental than others. Looking over the list of updates shows a healthy amount of variety. Nuclear Winter was a battle royale mode, engineered by a fictional in-game super-AI and rich with cosmetic rewards. Steel Dawn was a two-part narrative update that had players fight alongside the Brotherhood of Steel, learning more about the enigmatic order. The Pitt and Atlantic City were host to Expeditions, new maps outside of the main zone of Appalachia. Now, with the most recent Skyline Valley update, Bethesda is expanding the original map to include a weird, dangerous area to explore in the south. The bigger structural updates have been peppered with smaller experiments: killer aliens, grilling meat with a super mutant and his brahmin buddy, mothman cults, and new tools for building comfier CAMPs.
âWeâre thankful to our community for giving us all the feedback and criticism they did so we could narrow our focus and fix the most critical issues,â said Rush. âWe feel that because of everything we went through with the game and the community, we have a strong and open dialogue with our fans to keep the game updated in the most impactful way for our players.
âHaving an awesome Community team that listens to the feedback and effectively communicates it back to the developers was a tremendous benefit; knocking down the walls between the developers and the players is the key so we can have constructive discourse where both sides feel engaged,â Rush added.
Not every experiment was successful; Nuclear Winter was removed, some events were quietly retired, and some quests are more fondly regarded than others. But combined with greater stability and sense of identity, the new updates have transformed Fallout 76 from a clown fiesta to a genuinely compelling game in a No Manâs Sky-esque redemption arc.
When looking back at past updates, Rush considers the most important lesson to be this: âOur players really love to play in our Appalachia. What I mean by this is, I look at Appalachia as the main character for this game, and the story is told by how it changes over time â both on the developer side, and through our players.â
Skyline Valley, the latest update, is an example of what expanding on Appalachia can be. While Expeditions require the player to jump on a vertibird and fly off to some distant locale, Skyline Valley changes the map weâve been exploring since 2018. âExpanding the borders of our map gives us additional opportunities to flesh out the world further through stories, new locations, and the inhabitants within,â Rush explained.
There are more updates on the way for Fallout 76, and by this point, the designers have figured out what works for the game. Experiments like the Burrows, or the Pitt, werenât always perfect â but they proved what worked and what didnât. Throughout this entire process, Fallout 76 has been backed by a brilliantly creative community of players who build CAMPs, tell cinematic stories, work as doctors, recreate Shakespeareâs productions, or run charity drives.
I recently loaded into Fallout 76 to play with a friend who had just downloaded the game, and we rocked up to an event. Once it concluded, the veterans ran up to my friend and dropped a couple of bags chock-full of goods â a welcoming gesture toward a new player, and a common ritual among longtime veterans.
âAs our game world changes, we would like to open opportunities for our more seasoned veterans,â said Rush. âWe have big plans to make the game more challenging and rewarding for our adventurers and builders alike. Powerful gear and new playstyles to conquer enormously nasty encounters, and new systems to encourage our builders to push even further, are all on the table.â Fallout 76 has come tremendously far during its life so far, and now that itâs been through such a rocky road, the rest of the journey almost feels like a victory lap.

Title: Talismanâs 5th edition will feature a cooperative expansion for the first time
Content:
Talisman: The Magical Quest Game, one of the OG dungeon crawlers, is back with a 5th edition release arriving on July 1. But Hasbroâs Avalon Hill imprint has more than just retro vibes on its mind. The company has also revealed Talisman: Alliances - Fate Beckons, an expansion arriving alongside the revamped board game. It will offer a cooperative mode of play for the first time in the franchiseâs 41-year history.
âWhen we were thinking about 5th edition, we didnât want to just reprint those old expansions and just recreate the existing content,â said strategic brand manager Patrick OâRourke in a press briefing earlier this week. âWe set out to explore âmore.â We wanted more game modes that could open the Talisman platform to more players and additional playstyles. And thatâs why we created Talisman: Alliances.â
In a traditional game of Talisman, players take on the roles of adventurers in the style of fantasy role-playing games â classes such as fighter, wizard, cleric, and thief. They utilize special powers and abilities in their quest for a mighty MacGuffin called the Crown of Command. Itâs a somewhat linear journey, and it often includes players fighting against one another. Alliances will upend that tradition by presenting players with a series of Trials that must be dealt with cooperatively, each one sealed inside a small cardboard box. 
âInstead of claiming the Crown or Command for yourself to win,â said associate brand manager Cait Drouin, âyouâll bury the Talismans in places of power, unseal the Portal of Power, and then defeat the adversary together. So players will need to share resources and fate to work together to complete five Trials with some very exciting surprises along the way.â
While we donât know for sure whatâs inside the boxes, it does appear to be miniature of some kind. The back of the game box says youâll âreveal unique mystery figuresâ as you go. So what are those figures? Our only clues are game materials that show a robed figure with a deer skull for a head; a conflagration with green-eyed monsters crawling out of it; a hero being pulled down by a mob; and a mysterious armored warrior holding a flag over a battlefield.
Avalon Hill stressed that Alliances is not a legacy-style game. Game designer Doug Hopkins stressed that there are no stickers, no writing on the game board, and no destroying of components.
âWeâre [...] rolling out the experience to you one trial at a time,â Hopkins said. âYouâll get that thrill of when you complete the trial to unlock the next box and see whatâs inside and then, of course, unlock the next trial so that hopefully you can watch the story unfold through multiple game sessions.â

              Prices taken at time of publishing.

Title: NewJeans is the PUBG collab I didnât know I needed
